Welcome to BMS Statistics’s documentation!

Sender package

Submodules

Sender.sender module

Sender.sender.get_readings_as_json_dump(readings: list) → str[source]

converts the json data to str and returns it.

Sender.sender.read_data_from_sensors(sensors: dict) → dict[source]

calls fetch_reading() function to read the data from the sensors and returns the data as dict for successful reading, a sensor should typically implement the Sensor interface

Sender.sender.send_readings(readings_count, writer: callable = <built-in function print>)[source]

prints the reading to the console writer accepts a function to which the readings will be redirected.

Module contents

Receiver package

Submodules

Receiver.compute_statistics module

This module computes statistics for the provided BMS data

Receiver.compute_statistics.calculate_statistics(data: list) → dict[source]

calculates basic statistics like min, max, simple moving average and returns it.

Receiver.compute_statistics.convert_to_single_dimension_dict(data: list) → dict[source]

Converts the given array of dict to single dimension data for convenience

Example:

[{"Temperature": 42, "StateOfCharge": 18},
    {"Temperature": 50, "StateOfCharge": 35},
] -> {"Temperature": [42, 50], "StateOfCharge": [18, 35]}

Receiver.receiver module

Receiver.receiver.convert_to_json(data: str) → Tuple[ValueError | None, dict | None][source]

converts the given str to data and return along with err value

Receiver.receiver.input_collector(input_count: int) → list[source]

collects the inputs by iterating the given number of times and returns it as list

Receiver.receiver.print_stats(data: list, writer: callable = <built-in function print>)[source]

prints the statistics to the console. Also accepts the second argument writer which should be a function the calculated statistics data will be forwarded to the writer function
